synonyms: ākṣiptaḥ—set in motion; kāla-sāmyena—by a suitable time; praveśaḥ—the entrance; syāt—should be; pravartakaḥ—named pravartaka.
translation: 'When the entrance of the actors is set in motion by the arrival of a suitable time, the entrance is called pravartaka.'

purport.content: This verse is from Nāṭaka-candrikā (12) by Śrīla Rūpa Gosvāmī.
